headline: Mouth-Watering Stuffed Mushrooms
description: These savory stuffed mushrooms are filled with cream cheese, minced garlic, Parmesan cheese, and cayenne pepper for a restaurant-worthy appetizer.

video.description: See how easy it is to make sensational stuffed mushrooms.
video.name: Mouth-Watering Stuffed Mushrooms

name: Mouth-Watering Stuffed Mushrooms

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Spray a baking sheet with cooking spray. Clean mushrooms with a damp paper towel; carefully break off stems. Chop stems extremely fine, discarding the tough end of stems.
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and chopped mushroom stems; fry until any moisture has evaporated, taking care not to burn garlic. Set aside to cool.

Stir in cream cheese, Parmesan cheese, black pepper, onion powder, and cayenne. The mixture will be very thick; use a teaspoon to fill each mushroom cap with a generous amount of stuffing. Arrange mushroom caps on the prepared cookie sheet.
Bake in the preheated oven until the mushrooms are piping hot, about 20 minutes.

review.reviewBody: Made this tonight and thought it would be good. I often make a grilled portobello w/ balsamic and usually a grueyre (sp) and a gorgonzola. This is good though. Would be excellent with crab, lobster or seasoned shrimp. It's a bit bland and too cheesy, kind of like what you may have found on a mid level diner's menu in the 1960s. Good news is that it's a blank slate. You can spice up, down, or outside the recipe however you please (Hmm how bout w a devilled egg type filling 😊) The only things I did differently was to add some grated Tillamook Brand colby jack (because I'm short on cheeses, I usually have 4 or 5) and drizzled melted butter on the filled caps, then sprinkled with breadcrumbs. I also used a mix of olive oil and homemade ghee (I almost always have it on hand. If you're not familiar with this great, healthful, supremely tasteful cooking fat, you need to be. Took me 40 years of cooking to 'discover' it. (thx India) I feel the filling could be spiced up a bit as I found it a bit bland. But a good squirt of Shiracha could pick that up a bit.

Absolutely love these stuffed mushrooms. Ive made them numerous times since the holidays. Only change I make is omitting the cayenne pepper, it's too spicy for my family and I. First time I made them, everyone loved them but they were too hot for our taste.
Best thing I can say about this recipe is that when I served it to my wife she said it was THE tastiest thing I'd ever made in 11 years of being together!

Made these for the Superbowl and they are delicious! I mixed melted butter & the filling seasonings along with panko and dipped the tops of the mushrooms in the panko mixture for a crunchy texture. Love!
Love! Making these today for Super Bowl. GOOOO BIRDDDSSS!!! Added a little goat cheese and spinach!
Excellent!
So good and so easy!
No but I would leave the cayenne out of it.
Followed the recipe and they were great. Will make them again.

Delicious and easy recipe. Made these right to the recipe and they were wonderful. Next time I will use smaller mushroom caps though. I think a smaller amount of the cream cheese filling per bite would be preferable for us. This recipe is really good. A must try if you like stuffed mushrooms.
These are easy to make and so delicious just as the recipe is. I’ve also added crab meat which is really good too! Definitely try these!
An absolute favorite of everyone who has eaten them at any of my gatherings TOTAL YUM!!!!
I do add crab meat and I pipe the filling into the mushroom cap. Don't even plate them drop the cooking sheet on the table and they are gone in no time.
No directions about the panko topping. Bit just sprinkled on top..Wonderful flavor.
Delicious! I have been using this recipe since 2013 and my children and grandchildren ask for them all the time if we are having a special dinner. (Even when it is not so special dinner)
Kept the recipe exactly as is. It was a HUGE hit at Thanksgiving!

Very easy to make and everybody loved them! The first time, I made them with button mushroom and they a real crowd pleaser. The second time I made them using portobello mushrooms - then topped them with a drizzle of marsala reduction glaze... OMG!!! This is my new "go to" appetizer.
Amazing
It was delicious. I used large portabella mushrooms and added some sharp cheddar cheese to the bottom of the mushroom before adding the filling.

I made a bit of a change, used every ingredient except the mushroom stems and instead used hot italian sausage that I browned and added garlic to. Then made the rest of the stuffed mushrooms as above. Fantastic! Served the extra stuffed mushrooms over steak, mushrooms with cream cheese schmear! Wife loved it too.

I changed the recipe a bit by sauteing finely chopped garlic, sweet onion, and mushroom stems until translucent. Turn off the heat, add 1 block of diced cream cheese and chopped imitation crab. Cover the pan to soften the cream cheese. Add parmesan cheese and mix. Stuffed each mushroom with the mixture and top them with shredded mozzarella cheese. Bake, then broil the last 5 minutes. Yum!

These are the best! People are still talking about them 1 month later. I used 24 smaller bite sized mushrooms. Panko crumbs on top add a nice little crunch. Definitely going into my all times fav folder!
They turned out perfect but I would encourage to get large mushrooms. I had about 1/2 c left over.
Wow this is one of my new favorite recipes and I wish I would have found it sooner. Added Crab to the stuffing and it was just amazing. Even the kids were gobbling them up.
Very easy and great appetizer to bring to Memorial Day party. Used 2 things of Bella mushrooms for 24 total
Great appetizer. Will make again

Tasty but the color is gray. I swirled in the cream cheese to break up the mass of gray. Also, cook the mushrooms at 350 degree F upside down for about 10 minutes on convection fan to remove as much moisture as possible.

Loved it ... simple, quick, excellent as is or great starting point ... I've made 2x's now, second time used about 6 oz. of CC - used about 2 TBSP of finely chopped onion before adding shrooms then garlic.... also I used Baby Bella so my stems were a tad smaller and I don't mind adding extra, can't have too many shrooms, right?! I cooked in a small toaster / air fryer type oven and they are ready in under 10 minutes every time.... I would suggest watching them the first time you make, as it depends on the oven / cooking appliance you use... Thanks for sharing - I LOVE ALLRECIPES.COM!
Took this to a party and they ate them up in about 10 minutes. Hit of the party!

Made them 5 star by hiding a sliced half of cherry tomato in the bottom before adding the filling, and add 3-4 capers on top before baking. Sprinkle with terragon. I often use crushed garlic crackers as a bread topping.
These were great alternative to the ones I’ve been making with bacon and then I’ll be shears. I think it’s a new favorite!
Fantastic and easy
They turned out yummy just the way they are! The second time I made them, i added some hot pepper and cheese on top

Great recipe. The intensity was perfect for me, but if you have someone who prefers something milder, decrease cayenne pepper to 1/8 teaspoon. I added about 3 Tablespoons of hot Italian sausage and browned it with the mushroom stems and garlic. It was fantastic!
I love just made them
Cut the filling ingredients in half but quite tasty. Might try adding some bread crumbs to lighten it up some.

So good. You can add a can of crab, or if I want to keep it vegetarian, I add some finely chopped water chestnuts. I also add about 1/4 cup shredded mozzarella. I place on parchment paper, and dust the tops with more parmesan and a little paprika. Use the ziploc bag method for the filling, as it makes the whole process much cleaner and easier. If I have very large mushrooms, I bake them unfilled for about 20 minutes, dump out the water that collects, then fill and bake as directed.
This is one of my favorite appetizer recipes. When it comes to stuffed mushrooms, this one can't be beat!

KETO friendly. I used avocado oil and spray instead of vegetable oil and PAM. Came out amazing considering I'm a butter/breadcrumb stuffed mushy kinda guy..lol. DEFINITELY gonna add fresh crabmeat next time.??
Added sharp cheddar cheese on top. Cayenne pepper gives it noticeable heat.
I tossed stems in garbage. Made the cheese mix, cooked until bubbly, then stirred around and sprinkled panko on for crunch with a light spray of canola oil. I served with ranch dip. YUMMY!!!

Followed the recipe as written other than opting to brush caps with melted butter. My mushrooms were all different sizes and weren't browned after 20 minutes. Left them in 10 minutes longer and they still hadn't browned. Put them under the broiler for a few minutes and they browned perfectly. They were a very big hit! Next time I will add Parmesan to cover each cap only to help with browning.

I make these every holiday and work party and they are true first to go! I do less cayenne to appease a group. Also, I mix grated parmigiana and Italian breadcrumbs and dip the tops in before the oven. The other reviews are right as far as having too much of the filling. I am making about 50 mushrooms, but will only double the filling recipe this time.
I thought they were delicious.

I hate mushrooms personally, but I always try to make something I know my guests will enjoy. This was smashing! Everyone wanted the recipe, and I was happy to share. Now I won't have to clean the "shrooms! Definitely a winner.
Very Good app and easy to make.
Delicious!! I left out the cayenne pepper but it turned out fine. Excellent recipe.

I made them they were pretty good I did not put Cayenne pepper in I’m not a big fan of spicy hot but I threw in extra garlic for some extra Zing…And I couldn’t make up my mind which cheese I wanted to put on top between Parmesan sharp cheddar and mozzarella so I used all three I was hoping to save some … For a snack later…but my granddaughter stopped by on the way home and ate most of them and took the rest home for her mother LOL I guess I’ll be making another batch.

Absolutely delicious & Easy to make! I added some chopped fresh thyme, refrigerated them, and popped in the toaster oven as desired for a quick healthy snack. The tip on putting the mixture into zip lock bag was great, made for nice presentation & I out the leftovers on scrabble eggs & veggies.

Awesome!! As someone else said, you will have plenty of filling for double the mushrooms. Only thing I did different was to fry the garlic and stems in bacon drippings. And I used three strips of chopped bacon in the stuffing. Not as healthy but very very good.
I have been making theses mushrooms for years. I've found that Red Pepper Flakes work better an a dash of Worcester.

The recipe is so easy and the stuffed mushrooms are great,.I just added one thing to the recipe, it was green chilli (Wow) what a great twist on these stuffed mushrooms. I will be making these stuffed mushrooms again. jay
No changes - Perfect just the way they are!!
Very good
AMAZING! try filling them using a pastry bag and large round piping tip, it works like a charm!

The stuffing for the mushrooms seemed more like something you'd put on a cracker for an appetizer. They are hard to handle, and kept falling over while in the oven. There was way, way too much cream cheese, and not enough seasonings. I just wasn't very pleased with the results, though I followed the recipe exactly. If I ever make these again, I'll cut the cream cheese to less than half, and add diced onions and stuffing or lots of bread crumbs. I would also oil the outside of the mushrooms, to keep them from shrinking and wrinkling like 120-yo old men. I would leave out the Cayenne pepper and add Thyme, or something more flavorful. Just my opinion.

I’d say these are just perfect. I did slice a bit off the bottom to keep them upright and used the scraps in the stuffing. The cayenne is just right and the flavors are great. I like the small amount of effort to reap big rewards.

This was tasty side dish. Used fresh mushrooms from Costco so they were naturally huge. Two mushrooms per person as side was just right. I added finely chopped onions and browned with garlic & diced mushroom stems. Skipped the onion power.
Easy and awesome!
My husband and I both loved it.
one of our favorites to serve as an app or snack or side with pasta... hubby gets giddy when he sees me making these. so good?

My family and friends love these. I follow the directions except I use maple flavored veggie sausage, I add chopped green onions to the mushroom stems and I use fresh garlic. I also replace the cream cheese with plain Greek yogurt. The tart yogurt with the maple flavor and a dash of the hot cayenne pepper are a taste explosion......so good !!
These were wonderful! I added some mild Italian sausage and Italian Seasoning but other than that followed the recipe (except I never measure spices, just add what I feel is right). Very Good!!!!
This is by far the best mushroom recipe I’ve ever used! I’ll take them to get together’s with friends and they absolutely eat them up!?
Fantastic! I've done these probably 15 times already (I just realized how to leave a review!!), and they are always a big hit!! Thanks for the super easy recipe!!
Awesome !!!
Excellent. Agree with other reviewers that you can use less cream cheese.

I used less cream cheese (4 oz) and I added some GF flavored bread crumbs (about a half cup). Otherwise, left the recipe the same. Brush mushrooms with olive oil and position in a (small) muffin tray to help hold shape while cooking. Delicious!
Love the addition of cayenne pepper and onion powder. I sprinkled some Italian style bread crumbs before putting it in the oven.
Made 1/2 a recipe as written and sprinkled Italian bread crumbs on top prior to baking. Brad loved it and said it tasted like restaurant food.
These were delicious. Pulled them out of the oven and between 2 people they were gone in just a few minutes. Yum.
Recipe is excellent, would work well as an appetizer at family parties!
Made these as is for yearsssss. Always a hit and very easy to prepare.

Absolutely delicious! I had mascarpone that I needed to use so subbed that for some of the cream cheese. Also finely chopped some shiitake mushrooms and baby bellas. Dipped tops of stuffed mushrooms in buttered panko. Will definitely make again. Family raved!
Cayenne was overwhelming, made me go back and check the recipe. Will not make again.
We’ve been making this recipe for many, many years. It’s delicious as is, but somewhere along the way we also started adding some cooked diced bacon into the cream cheese mix. Delicious!
they were good. i did not have cream cheeses. any substitutes when you run out of an ingredient?
Very good. Rave reviews from guests. I added a bit of worcestershire sauce and that put the filling over the top.
I could only find large portobello mushrooms, I used 6 of them and they were very good
I wasn't sure about this recipe because it's different from the norm, but WOW! Outstanding. Even leftovers in toaster oven were fabulous. Started talking about what else we could put filling on.
Nope. Followed the recipe. I’ll know more once we try them! I tasted the topping and it’s delish.

These have been my “go-to” appetizer for all of my family’s potlucks for years. Last holiday, my aunt and my sister each tried their hand at making stuffed mushrooms, and everyone agreed that mine were still the reigning champs! It is rare that I don’t tamper with the ingredients in a recipe, but this one is perfect as is!!
AmAzing !
Yes , I added 1/4 cup Panko to mixture before all the moisture had cooked out . This helped the mixture bind a bit .
Very easy and made house smell amazing. Tasty would make again
I don't think I'll make these again - they were OK, but not much more than that. We prefer other stuffed mushrooms I've made in the past.
These were so good!!!
Delicious just the way it is!

I made these stuffed mushrooms last night. I told my bf that I wouldn't be offended if they turned out terrible because it was my first time ever making them. I forgot to add the parm cheese to the cream cheese mixture, so I added it on top. They were absolutely DELICIOUS and super easy!
These are delicious! I did make one change, which probably means that this is not a true evaluation; So be it. I added crab meat, and wow!
Made mine in the Airfryer, turned out great!
These were way too heavy and cream cheesy. 8oz of cream cheese was overload
This is a perfect recipie which always gets lots of compliments. So fast and easy. Some different combinations I've tried is adding green onion with the garlic and mozzarella cheese instead of parm.

This was an Amazing recipe that tried for this Thanksgiving day and it was a Big Hit!! Preparation was easy and cook time was fast. I did change it a little by adding real bacon bits (3) strips per batch, I made two batches. I also added finely chopped green onions and used Baby Portabella’s. Microwave the cream cheese for (1) minute and will be perfectly thawed. Everyone said they were Amazing!! This is a must recipe that can easily be made and served in an hour. 
Excellent!!
I have made this several times and it is very good! I always have too much cream cheese. Next time, I might try 6oz instead of the 8oz that it calls for.
Delicious!! Even the 3&5yo ate them! I had ground spicy sausage I was using for another dish. I reserved 1/4c for the mushrooms and it added a yummy richness
Made exactly how the recipe is written. I will be cutting some of the cayenne pepper next time, but it is a for sure repeat recipe.
Yummy! I used onion flakes and grated asiago, because that's what I had, and they came out just fine.
Incredible! We added panko bread crumbs and cooked sausage then topped with more panko bread crumbs and melted butter-deeeelish! Thanks for sharing!
